title: (x) What is this Retro Script style font - Thank you for Shopping With Us? - based on Bookman Italic {Craig, Riccardo}
content:
Hello!

I suspect this is a pretty easy one, but i'm coming up blank on my searches.

Very straightforward retro font used on the 'Thankyou for Shopping with Us' carrier bags

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150105030826im_/http:/img.photobucket.com/albums/v132/boyinabearsuit/IMG_1508.jpg)

[IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v132/boyinabearsuit/IMG\_1508.jpg[/IMG]

Thanks in advance! :-)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [carrierbag.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150105030826/http:/typophile.com/files/carrierbag_0.jpg) | 102.96 KB |
author: boyinabearsuit

comments.content:
Hi Niall,  
welcome to Typophile!  
There’s no image. Need help? [How to post a sample or image](http://web.archive.org/web/20150105030826/http:/typophile.com/node/18067)  
In particular, make sure that:

- the file name does not contain spaces (or any other ø∂∂ ¢håræct€rs)
- you have the right [Flash plugin](http://web.archive.org/web/20150105030826/http:/www.adobe.com/products/flashplayer/) installed with your browser
Hi - yes, thats the one. Just tried attaching image, not happening. Grrrrr.

Looks like a hand-done version of Bookman with swashes.  
 [http://www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000085](http://web.archive.org/web/20150105030826/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000085 "http://www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000085")

I agree. It is very similar to Bookman Swash Italic. found here...  
 [http://www.fonts.com/FindFonts/detail.htm?pid=415679](http://web.archive.org/web/20150105030826/http:/www.fonts.com/FindFonts/detail.htm?pid=415679 "http://www.fonts.com/FindFonts/detail.htm?pid=415679")

But certain parts do look to be hand rendered.
